Ketua Umum PSSI Bertemu Menpora, Bahas Piala Dunia U-20 2021
04 Nov 2019, 09:37 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule tiba di Kantor Kementerian Pemuda dan Olahraga sekitar pukul 13.56 WIB. Mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya ini datang didampingi Wakil Ketua Umum PSSI, Cucu Sumantri. Keduanya langsung menuju ke lantai 10 Gedung Kemenpora yang merupakan ruangan Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga Zainudin Amali. Iwan Bule tampak memakai seragam polisi dan Cucu Sumantri mengenakan seragam TNI Angkatan Darat.
Sepuluh menit sebelum, Sekretaris Jenderal PSSI Ratu Tisha lebih dulu menyambangi Kantor Kemenpora. Satu wakil ketua Umum PSSI lainnya, Iwan Budianto tidak hadir karena lagi berada di Malang, Jawa Timur.
Menpora, Zainudi Amali, mengatakan kedatangan Iwan Bule bersama jajaran pengurus PSSI untuk melaporkan mengenai beberapa hal seputar sepak bola. Pertemuan itu membahas sejumlah hal, di antaranya mengenai persiapan tuan rumah Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021 dan perintah dari Inpres Nomor 3 Tahun 2019 tentang Percepatan Sepak Bola Nasional.
Dalam Inpres yang diterbitkan itu, Presiden Jokowi meminta PSSI segera menyelesaikan pembuatan road map sepak bola nasional. "Pemerintah dan PSSI sudah saling memahami fungsi dan tugas masing-masing," kata dia dalam konfrensi pers seusai pertemuan di Kantor Kemenpora, Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Iwan Bule menjelaskan, dalam pertemuan dengan Menpora, ia melaporkan mengenai lapangan yang bakal digunakan untuk Piala Dunia U-20 dan tempat latihan yang bakal disediakan. "Nanti kami bersama-sama dengan Kemenpora untuk mengevaluasi kembali untuk melihat kembali lapangan yang memang masih dalam tahap renovasi dan lain sebagainya," kata dia mengungkap isi diskusi dengan Zainudin Amali.
Sekretaris Utama Lemhanas ini mengatakan bahwa ia diminta oleh Menpora untuk segera menyelesaikan road map sepak bola nasional. Hal itu sesuai dengan Inpres Nomor 3 tahun 2019 tentang Percepatan Sepak Bola Nasional. "Kami diminta road map segera ditindaklanjuti," kata dia mengungkapkan keinginan pemerintah.

PSSI Chairperson Meets Menpora, Discuss 2021 U-20 World Cup
Nov 04 2019, 09:37 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - General Chair of PSSI 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule arrived at the Office of the Ministry of Youth and Sports around 13.56 WIB. The former Metro Jaya Police Chief came accompanied by the Deputy Chairman of the PSSI, Cucu Sumantri. Both of them went straight to the 10th floor of the Ministry of Youth and Sports Building which is the Minister of Youth and Sports Zainudin Amali's room. Iwan Bule was seen wearing a police uniform and Cucu Sumantri was wearing an Army uniform.
Ten minutes before, PSSI Secretary General Ratu Tisha visited the Kemenpora Office first. One other vice chairman of PSSI, Iwan Budianto was not present because he was again in Malang, East Java.
The Menpora, Zainudi Amali, said the arrival of Iwan Bule along with the PSSI board of management to report on a number of things about football. The meeting discussed a number of things, including the preparations for the host of the 2021 U-20 World Cup and orders from Presidential Instruction Number 3 of 2019 concerning National Football Acceleration.
In the issued Presidential Instruction, President Jokowi asked PSSI to immediately complete the national soccer road map. "The government and PSSI have understood each other's functions and duties," he said at a press conference after a meeting at the Ministry of Youth and Sports, Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Iwan Bule explained, in a meeting with Menpora, he reported on the field that would be used for the U-20 World Cup and the training ground that would be provided. "Later we together with Kemenpora to re-evaluate to look back at the field which is still under renovation and so forth," he said revealing the contents of the discussion with Zainudin Amali.
The Lemhanas Main Secretary said that he was asked by the Menpora to immediately complete the national soccer road map. This is in accordance with Presidential Instruction Number 3 of 2019 concerning the Acceleration of National Football. "We are asked to follow up on the road map," he said, expressing the government's wishes.

IRSYAN HASYIM
